Posts.Content: Hi I am recovering from BC    My advice to you is see your GP for immediate advice/referral for tests. No one, not even a BC Consultant can diagnose anyone without mammogram/scan/biopsy.  The sooner you seek advice the sooner you will get peace of mind.  If it is cancer the sooner it is treated the better your survival   Good luck and see your GP as soon as possible  Report Reply
Posts.Title: Breast Question

Posts.Content: Hi  I had a mastectomy and had part reconstruction may 2017. It takes about 6 months to fully complete reconstruction from having expander fitted during mastectomy operation to having the exchange with the implant. I can honestly say my whole experience was fine. I would also say that I lost my nipple due to type of cancer. I had lobular. Hope this helps. Good luck with your op.  Report
Posts.Title: Post mastectomy options
Anyone got diagnosed with stage 2 lobular carcinoma of breast oestrogen positive

Posts.Content: oh I am pleased you are feeling well. Good luck with the rest of your results and treatment xx Report
Posts.Title: Anyone got diagnosed with stage 2 lobular carcinoma of breast oestrogen positive

Posts.Content: Yes I was diagnosed in May   I had masectomy as they found 2 tumors which were too far apart to do lumpectomy.  Cancer did not spread to lymph nodes so did not need radiotherapy as it would not benefit me.  They did a further test which is only done in America  to see whether chemo would benefit me.  Thankfully I did not need chemo as my score was border line.  My treatment is therefore letrozole tablets for 5 years and also zoledronic acid which is given by infusion every 6 months.  This treatment is for 3 years.  I am currently undergoing reconstruction which will hopefully be complete later this year.    ?Please remember everyones treatment is unique to them.  So my advice to you is just to concentrate on yourself and listen to your Surgeon My experience tells me they know what they are doing.  If you need any further help please do not hesitate to contact me. ?Good luck.  Report
Posts.Title: Anyone got diagnosed with stage 2 lobular carcinoma of breast oestrogen positive

Posts.Content: Please see your GP ASAP.  This happened to me 11 months ago and unfortunately it was lobular Breast cancer   Drs caught it early. I had to have a mastectomy. I also underwent immediate reconstruction.  Yours may not be BC but get it checked by Medical expert who will be able to put your mind at rest. I am cancer free now and enjoying life again  Best of luck. Keep me updated  Report Reply
Posts.Title: Inverted nipples

Posts.Content: My nipple was inverted but stayed that way and unfortunately I was diagnosed with lobular Breast cancer 12 months ago. I had a mastectomy and immediate reconstruction. I am now cancer  free I cannot emphasise enough to you to go and see your gp and get yourself checked as soon as possible by a medical professional. The earlier cancer is caught the better chance of a full recovery albeit you may not have cancer. Good luck and let me know how you get on xx Report 1 Reply
Posts.Title: Inverted nipple

Posts.Content: Hi Janice I would make an appt with your gp and let the medical professionals decide if it is a problem. Unfortunately I don’t know the answer.  It will put your mind st ease as there may be a simple explanation. Take care xx Report 1 Reply
